remarks: Principle of Mathematical Induction on all integers, deduction version. The first five hypotheses give the substitutions; the last three are the basis, the induction, and the extension to negative numbers. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 17-Apr-2009.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 4-Jan-2017.)
statement:
zindd.1 $e |- ( x = 0 -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
zindd.2 $e |- ( x = y -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
zindd.3 $e |- ( x = ( y + 1 ) -> ( ph <-> ta ) ) $.
zindd.4 $e |- ( x = -u y -> ( ph <-> th ) ) $.
zindd.5 $e |- ( x = A -> ( ph <-> et ) ) $.
zindd.6 $e |- ( ze -> ps ) $.
zindd.7 $e |- ( ze -> ( y e. NN0 -> ( ch -> ta ) ) ) $.
zindd.8 $e |- ( ze -> ( y e. NN -> ( ch -> th ) ) ) $.
zindd $p |- ( ze -> ( A e. ZZ -> et ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d ch x $.
$d et x $.
$d ph y $.
$d ps x $.
$d ta x $.
$d th x $.
$d x y ze $.
